intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. samnaunicum, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its dark purple to black flowers are clustered in dense heads, and it has a fibrous root system. It is often found in calcareous soils and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
